item.description:
The Goethe German Film series is back for 2012. They always an eclectic selection.

About the film:

The new film from Andreas Dresen, one of Germany's most admired directors, focuses on a man who has been told that he has a terminal illness. What does one person do with the last days of his life?

Winner Un Certain Regard at the Cannes 2011 Film Festival, Stopped on Track (Halt auf freier Strecke) is a heartrending tale of loss and love; it is told with great aplomb by Dresen who casts real-life medical workers in the roles of the doctors and nurses who have to break bad news every day of their lives.

We'll go to an area restaurant for discussion after the film.

Hope to see you there!

Lisa
item.how_to_find_us: After the film I'll be near the exit holding a Meetup sign.
